column1: 2	http://reuters.com/article/us-puertorico-debt-board-idUSKCN11628X	Puerto Rico oversight board appointed	"
By Susan Cornwell and Nick Brown
| WASHINGTON/NEW YORK
WASHINGTON/NEW YORK President Barack Obama on Wednesday appointed a seven-member board to oversee a financial restructuring for Puerto Rico
column2: a majority Republican panel that some market analysts saw as favorable for bondholders of the U.S. territory
column3: which has been crippled by a $70 billion debt crisis.Among the board members
column4: who Obama appointed on the recommendation of legislative leaders
column5: are Arthur Gonzalez
column6: a Democrat and a retired bankruptcy judge who oversaw the Chapter 11 cases of Chrysler and Enron
column7: and Carlos Garcia
column8: a Republican and the former head of Puerto Rico's Government Development Bank who now runs private equity firm BayBoston.The other appointees are Republicans Andrew Biggs
column9: David Skeel and Jose Carrion III
column10: and Democrats Jose Ramon Gonzalez and Ana Matosantos.The idea of a fiscal control board
column11: known colloquially as La Junta in Puerto Rico
column12: is largely reviled on the island
column13: which has a 45 percent poverty rate and whose chronic economic slump has helped spur rampant outmigration. Among the messages by protesters and graffiti artists plastered around San Juan are: ""Wake up! They're selling our homeland!"" and ""Say no to oppression."" But from a market perspective the board figures to be a positive for creditors of the island
column15: president of hedge fund Maglan Capital. He particularly cited Garcia
column17: very intertwined with everything that has happened up until now.""And the Democrats on the panel are more moderate than expected
column18: Height Securities analyst Daniel Hanson said in note.

column1: Jose Gonzalez
column2: president and chief executive officer of the Federal Home Loan Bank of New York
column3: may be the ""key swing vote"" for creditor-friendly policies
column4: Hanson said.Keefe Bruyette & Woods analyst Chas Tyson
column5: in a note last week
column6: listed Jose Gonzalez
column7: a former Santander executive
column8: as a potential creditor ally because of his ""significant experience in Puerto Rico's banking sector.""The board was created under the federal law known as PROMESA
column10: which will bring Puerto Rico's finances under federal oversight and give it the authority to restructure some of its debt.

column1: The board will be tasked with assessing and certifying annual budgets and a fiscal recovery plan presented by the island's government
column2: as well as facilitating debt restructuring talks on the island
column3: possibly through a bankruptcy-like process.One interesting pick is Skeel
column4: a professor at the University of Pennsylvania Law School. Though Republicans are generally seen as creditor-friendly
column5: Skeel
column6: a restructuring industry veteran
column7: has repeatedly called for a broad-based restructuring in Puerto Rico. But he has also stressed that creditor rights should be protected in such a scenario
column8: possibly a good sign for the fate of Puerto Rico's general obligation debt. That debt is viewed as sacrosanct in municipal debt markets
column9: but it has no legal security under bankruptcy law
column10: which has given some GO holders reason to fret.

column1: Importantly
column2: much of the negotiation tactics may be driven by the team of lawyers and financial advisers the board will ultimately select to represent it.     Restructuring consultant Martha Kopacz
column3: of Phoenix Management Services
column4: and veteran bankruptcy lawyer Richard Levin
column5: of Jenner & Block
column6: are among the professionals said to be lobbying to represent the board
column7: according to people familiar with the situation. House of Representatives Speaker Paul Ryan and Senate Majority Leader Mitch McConnell
column9: each chose two members of the board
column10: while House and Senate Minority Leaders Nancy Pelosi and Harry Reid
column12: made one pick apiece. Obama chose the seventh member. (Reporting by Susan Cornwell and Nick Brown; Additional reporting by Robin Respaut; Writing by Nick Brown; Editing by Chizu Nomiyama and Leslie Adler)"

column1: 3	http://reuters.com/article/us-autos-takata-probe-idUSKCN1161TG	Takata parts involved in blast were shipped properly: NTSB	"
By Bernie Woodall
An initial check showed that Takata Corp (7312.T) air bag parts and material involved in a deadly explosion in a truck in Texas last week were being shipped properly
column2: a U.S. regulator said on Wednesday.A spokesman for the National Transportation Safety Board said the agency's hazardous material team made the determination along with the Federal Motor Carrier Safety Administration
column3: which conducted an initial survey of shipping documents. The NTSB said it will decide in the next few weeks whether a deeper investigation is needed into the incident
column4: which occurred on Aug. 22 near Quemado
column5: Texas
column6: and left one woman dead and four other people injured..Such a probe was called for earlier on Wednesday by two U.S. senators
column7: Richard Blumenthal and Edward Markey
column8: both Democrats who are members of the Senate Committee on Commerce
column9: Science and Transportation.The NTSB said in a statement that it has asked to review all documents related to the incident.

column1: Initial indicators are that the materials were packaged properly. If the review of documents and other information shows cause to investigate
column2: the NTSB will do so
column3: it said in a statement.Takata's air bag inflators
column4: which contain ammonium nitrate
column5: have been linked to at least 14 deaths and more than 150 injuries and resulted in the largest vehicle recall in history.Prolonged exposure of the defective Takata inflators to hot and humid conditions has been found to cause air bags to explode with excessive force
column6: spraying shrapnel into passenger compartments.

column1: The NTSB ""must investigate this incident and determine whether this company took appropriate precautions
column2: said a statement by the senators
column3: both Democrats.The senators noted that ammonium nitrate is also used in agricultural fertilizers and as an explosive for construction and mining industries. They said they want to protect against future incidents in highway shipments of the chemical compound.

column1: We also seek answers on what steps must be taken to ensure other towns and communities aren't endangered by the shipment of ammonium nitrate on our highways
column2: they said.         The NTSB
column3: an independent safety investigation agency
column4: focuses on studying accidents to determine if lessons can be learned that could lead to increased safety.The Texas Department of Public Safety is also investigating the incident
column5: and the NTSB said it stands by to assist Texas officials upon request. (Reporting by Bernie Woodall in Detroit; Editing by Alan Crosby and Leslie Adler)"

column1: 4	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-mexico-idUSKCN1162PR	Mexican president's invitation to Trump sparks blowback	"
By Dave Graham
| MEXICO CITY
MEXICO CITY Within minutes of Donald Trump saying he would visit Mexico
column2: one of the front-runners to become the country's next president hit back
column3: saying the brash White House hopeful would not be welcome.That was just a start.Scorn rained down on both Mexican President Enrique Pena Nieto and the U.S. Republican presidential nominee after the two announced late on Tuesday they would meet during a brief trip by Trump to the country he has repeatedly attacked during his presidential campaign.Before it even took place
column4: the visit was a public relations disaster for Pena Nieto as politicians and diplomats condemned him for inviting a man who has united Mexican like few others in shared disdain.Since launching his White House bid in June last year
column5: Trump has vowed to seal off the country behind a border wall he says Mexico will pay for
column6: tarred its migrants as rapists and drug pushers and threatened to expel millions of them
column7: as well as saying he will revise or tear up a trade deal with Mexico if he wins office in November.Mexican cabinet ministers have called Trump ignorant and racist
column8: and Pena Nieto earlier this year likened Trump's tilt for the top job to the rise of Adolf Hitler
column9: so the sudden invitation to the real estate mogul was a hard sell to the public.""Mr Trump may have been invited but he knows he's not welcome
column11: wife of former president Felipe Calderon and one of the favorites to succeed Pena Nieto at the next election in 2018
column12: said on Twitter. ""Mexicans have dignity and we reject his hate speech

column1: A few dozen people gathered beneath a soaring monument to Mexican Independence in central Mexico City on Wednesday to protest the New Yorker's visit
column2: some holding placards emblazoned with captions such as ""You are not Wall-come"" and ""Trump and Pena out"".""Trump has badmouthed Mexicans
column3: it's appalling that the president has invited him
column4: said Abril Marquez
column5: a 23-year-old law student holding a sign saying ""Trump
column6: you're not welcome!""Traditionally bitter political adversaries in Mexico have been united in their rejection of Trump
column7: making Wednesday's hastily-arranged encounter a gamble with few obvious benefits for Pena Nieto
column8: whose approval ratings are at all-time lows.Gang violence is at the worst levels of his term
column9: anger over political corruption is widespread
column10: the peso currency is near record lows and the centrist president's personal integrity is in question after a report that he plagiarized his university thesis. A government spokesman played down the accusation
column11: saying there were ""style errors"" in the paper.

column1: 'UNWORTHY' OF GOVERNMENT
Andres Rozental
column2: a former deputy Mexican foreign minister responsible for North America
column3: said he was at a loss to explain the Trump visit
column4: describing it as a ""big mistake"" by the government.""Unless (Trump) comes out and makes a public statement disavowing all the things that he's said
column5: which I doubt very much that he will do
column6: I don't think there's really anything that Pena Nieto can get out of this
column7: he said.

column1: Miguel Barbosa
column2: Senate leader of the leftist opposition Party of the Democratic Revolution
column3: who worked with Pena Nieto to push through landmark economic reforms earlier in his term
column4: said the president was allowing himself to be used by Trump.""You don't understand
column5: Barbosa said
column6: directing a tweet at Pena Nieto
column7: ""the presence of (Trump) in Mexico at your invitation is behavior unworthy of the Mexican government.""Even the man Pena Nieto picked a year ago to be his ambassador to the United States did not hold back.""Nobody in the last 50 years has put Mexican-U.S. relations in such danger as Trump
column9: an old friend of Pena Nieto who was replaced in April as ambassador after seven months in the job
column10: said on Twitter. ""I find the invitation deeply regrettable.""Trump has helped stir the bad blood with comments on Twitter during his campaign. Even as he prepared for his quick visit he was in a Twitter spat with a prominent critic south of the border
column12: another former Mexican president. (Additional reporting by Noe Torres
column14: Angela Moon and Veronica Gomez; Editing by Kieran Murray and Frances Kerry)"

column1: 5	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-clinton-idUSKCN11615V	Clinton touts 'American exceptionalism' in appeal to Republicans	"
By Jonathan Allen
| CINCINNATI
CINCINNATI Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton
column2: speaking to a U.S. veterans group on Wednesday
column3: made an open appeal to Republican and independent voters concerned about rival Donald Trump's national security credentials and his fitness for office.""This election shouldn't be about ideology. It's not just about differences over policy
column4: Clinton told an American Legion convention in Cincinnati. ""It truly is about who has the experience and the temperament to serve as president and commander in chief.""Clinton
column5: a former secretary of state and former U.S. senator

column7: a term frequently used by conservatives in a foreign-policy context.""When we say America is exceptional ... it means that we recognize America's unique and unparalleled ability to be a force for peace and progress
column8: Clinton told the veterans. ""When America fails to lead
column9: we leave a vacuum.""She harshly rebuked Trump
column10: accusing him of advocating a retreat from global affairs and suggesting that his calls for U.S. forces to torture terror suspects and threaten their families would make the country less safe.

column1: The speech came on the same day that Trump was slated to meet with Mexico's president
column2: Enrique Pena Nieto
column3: in Mexico City in an attempt to bolster his own foreign-policy profile before delivering a speech on immigration policy Wednesday evening in Arizona.In her speech

column5: she secured another one from James Clad
column6: a former deputy assistant secretary of defense under President George W. Bush.

column1: In a comment that has sparked criticism from many Republicans

column6: he said

column1: John Feehery

column5: he said. ""Most voters think we should focus on the home front."" (Reporting By Caren Bohan and James Oliphant in Washington and Jonathan Allen in Cincinnati.; Editing by Richard Balmforth and Jonathan Oatis)"

column1: 6	http://reuters.com/article/us-maine-lepage-trump-idUSKCN11616V	Maine governor's outburst tests limits of anger politics	"
By Scott Malone
(Editor's note: This story contains language that may offend readers in the fourth paragraph)By Scott MaloneBOSTON Years before Donald Trump dominated the news cycle with his style of angry politics
column2: Maine Governor Paul LePage made headlines with a similarly brash approach.Since he was elected in 2010
column3: the Republican has told critics of his decision to skip a civil rights breakfast to ""kiss my butt"" and accused a Democratic rival of forcing budget measures on taxpayers ""without Vaseline.""But when LePage
column4: the second U.S. governor to endorse Trump
column5: recently left an obscenity-laced voicemail message for a lawmaker who he believed had called him a racist
column6: he put his career in jeopardy.LePage's widely circulated verbal attack
column7: in which he called Democratic State Representative Drew Gattine a ""little son-of-a-bitch
column9: sparked the most intense firestorm of criticism the second-term governor has seen. Even legislative leaders from his own party called him into a closed-door meeting to discuss his future.The reaction shows that not all politicians can get away with the kind of bellicose approach that helped Trump wipe out his primary rivals and win the support of angry voters who feel U.S. politicians do not care about their problems.""Trump is a master of media and LePage is not. They are very different at the end of the day
column11: chairman of the government and legal studies department at Maine's Bowdoin College. ""Trump says he hates the media
column12: but he works it very well. LePage just hates it.""

column1: The governor infamously joked in 2013 that he would like to blow up the offices of the Portland Press Herald newspaper
column2: which he felt treated him unfairly.On Wednesday
column3: LePage told reporters he had met with Gattine and apologized
column4: and that he had no plans to resign from office. Asked what might change about his governing style
column5: LePage responded that he would no longer speak with reporters.""I will no longer speak to the press ever again after today
column6: LePage said. ""I'm serious. Everything will be put in writing. I am tired of being caught
column7: the gotcha moments.""That came a day after LePage openly discussed the idea of stepping down in a regular monthly interview with a Maine radio station. He later backed away from his comments
column10: ""The reports of my political demise are greatly exaggerated.""

column1: TRUMP BEFORE TRUMP""
LePage endorsed Trump's run in February
column2: shortly after New Jersey Governor Chris Christie did. ""I was Donald Trump before Donald Trump became popular
column3: LePage said at the time
column4: saying that the wealthy New York businessman and reality TV star ""could be one of the greatest presidents if he sits down and puts together a good team.""

column1: Trump has also praised LePage
column2: saying that he would offer him a role in his administration ""if he were available.""Both men describe their political styles as authentic and off-the-cuff and accuse more measured rivals of being career politicians who are out of touch with the needs of average voters.LePage's brusqueness played well in Maine until recently. He won re-election in a three-way 2014 race with the support of 48 percent of voters with a wider margin of victory than the 38 percent he garnered in his first run
column3: also a three-way race.Neil Levesque
column4: executive director of the New Hampshire Institute of Politics said that success
column5: coupled with Trump's rise
column6: could have emboldened LePage to double down on attack politics.""Almost anything goes now. You can call your opponents almost anything
column7: you can threaten them
column8: Levesque said. ""This is the new norm in American politics."" (Editing by Andrew Hay and Jeffrey Benkoe)"

column1: 7	http://reuters.com/article/us-virginia-felons-idUSKCN1162K9	Virginia Republicans seek to block governor's voting rights restoration	"
By Ian Simpson
Virginia Republican leaders said they will file a contempt motion on Wednesday against Democratic Governor Terry McAuliffe over his efforts to restore voting rights to about 206
column2: 000 felons.The motion comes the week after McAuliffe said he had restored voting rights to almost 13
column3: 000 felons on a case-by-case basis after the state Supreme Court blocked his blanket clemency effort.McAuliffe's executive order was seen as a possible aid in tipping Virginia
column4: a swing state in the Nov. 8 presidential election
column5: in favor of Democratic nominee Hillary Clinton. Opinion polls show her leading Republican candidate Donald Trump in the state.""After a thorough legal review
column6: it is clear that Governor McAuliffe has once again illegally suspended the Constitution of Virginia
column7: House of Delegates Speaker William Howell said in a statement. He was joined in the 27-page motion by Senate Majority Leader Thomas Norment and four voters.

column1: The Republican lawmakers said they would ask the high court to hold McAuliffe in contempt for his bid to work around the justices' July 22 ruling that he lacked the constitutional authority to restore felons' political rights as a group.McAuliffe criticized the motion
column2: saying his office has complied with the order and set up a process that was in line with it.

column1: The people who have filed it are more concerned with the impact new voters could have on Donald Trump's campaign than they are with the dignity of the people whom they continue to drag through the mud with their political lawsuits and ugly attacks
column2: he said in a statement.McAuliffe has said his original order would move Virginia away from lifetime disenfranchisement that hits African-Americans particularly hard.

column1: Many of the convicts who benefited were African-Americans or Latinos

column3: a Democrat

column1: 8	http://reuters.com/article/us-usa-election-republicans-idUSKCN1150BA	McCain
column2: Rubio win Republican nod in U.S. Senate races	"

column1: By Richard Cowan
| WASHINGTON
WASHINGTON Republican U.S. senators John McCain and Marco Rubio won their party's nominations on Tuesday to seek re-election in Arizona and Florida in November
column2: as both of the high profile politicians defeated insurgent challengers.McCain
column3: the 2008 failed Republican presidential candidate
column4: now faces a spirited challenge in Arizona from Democrat Ann Kirkpatrick
column5: who has served in the U.S. House of Representatives since 2011 and wants to move to the Senate.McCain has said this year's race could be the toughest of a political career spanning more than three decades.In advancing to the general election
column6: the 80-year-old McCain handily beat ex-state Senator Kelli Ward
column8: a conservative Tea Party activist and a follower of Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump.Like McCain
column9: Rubio also is girding for a potentially tough challenge on Nov. 8.Also in Florida
column10: U.S. Representative Debbie Wasserman Schultz overcame a challenger - and the embarrassment of being stripped last month of her job as head of the Democratic National Committee - and will get a shot at a seventh House term in the Nov. 8 general elections.She beat law professor Tim Canova
column11: an outspoken Wall Street critic aligned with U.S. Senator Bernie Sanders.The non-traditional campaigns of Trump and Sanders
column12: who exceeded expectations in his failed Democratic White House bid
column13: spurred speculation that other insurgent politicians could make an impact this year.

column1: But that didn't happen in either of the closely watched nominating races in Florida and Arizona.Rubio
column2: who abandoned his presidential campaign in March
column3: cleared the initial hurdle in his battle for a second six-year term in the U.S. Senate. He defeated novice politician Carlos Beruff
column4: a millionaire homebuilder
column5: who embraced Trump.U.S. Representative Patrick Murphy
column6: a Democrat
column7: won his party's Senate nomination on Tuesday
column8: and is expected to give g Rubio a tough fight
column9: especially if Democratic presidential candidate Hillary Clinton leads Trump in Florida.There is speculation that Rubio might still harbor presidential ambitions after media reports this week that he had refused to commit to serving all six years of a Senate term if he were re-elected.

column1: Trump has endorsed McCain and Rubio in their re-election bids even though he has rocky relations with both.How McCain and Rubio fare could have a big say in whether Republicans can defy expectations and maintain majority control of the Senate after November's election.""The balance of the Senate and the outcome of the presidential election are all hanging on Florida
column2: Rubio predicted in a fundraising appeal late on Tuesday. Trump offended McCain and many other Republicans last year by suggesting the maverick senator was anything but a war hero because he was captured during the Vietnam War after his airplane was shot down during a bombing mission.

column1: In March
column2: Trump ended Rubio's presidential run by trouncing him in the Florida primary to cap a race in which the New York businessman taunted the first-term senator as ""little Marco.""Rubio fired back
column3: insulting Trump on everything from his hair color and the size of his hands to misspelled words in tweets.During their re-election efforts
column4: both McCain and Rubio have offered support for Trump as the party's White House nominee and steered clear of attacks on that might antagonize Trump's core supporters.But they have tiptoed around Trump
column5: mainly out of concern that his provocative comments on illegal immigration
column6: Muslims and U.S. support for NATO could alienate moderate and independent voters in their states.(This version of the story corrects McCain's failed presidential bid in second paragraph to 2008
column7: from 2012) (Reporting by Richard Cowan; Editing by Peter Cooney and Simon Cameron-Moore)"

column1: 9	http://reuters.com/article/us-new-jersey-wages-idUSKCN1152JA	New Jersey Governor Christie vetoes minimum wage hike to $15/hr	"
By Hilary Russ

column2: Christie said in a statement. State voters agreed to a previous wage hike in 2013
column3: to $8.25 from $7.25. New Jersey's rate is tied to the consumer price index and is now at $8.38
